message.content:
cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.PF, cs.SY, cs.PL 

The paper presents a new method for the accurate analysis of the quality-of-service (QoS) properties of component-based systems. This involves refining a high-level continuous-time Markov chain (CTMC) model of the system based on observations of the execution times of the system components. The refined CTMC can then be analysed with existing probabilistic model checkers to accurately predict the value of the QoS property. This paper is likely to belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) category as it deals with the development of a new method for QoS analysis of component-based systems. It may also belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) category as it involves the analysis of a system with multiple components. Additionally, it may belong to the Probability (cs.PF) and Systems and Control (cs.SY) categories as it involves probabilistic modelling and control of a system. Finally, it may belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) category as it involves the development of a tool to automate the model refinement process.
